content: Yes, the NFB has a number of programs that aim to support and promote diverse voices in filmmaking. For example, the Indigenous Cinema program showcases Indigenous-made films, documentaries and animation, both in Canada and around the world. Another program, called Expositions, features works by artists from diverse cultural backgrounds, including Black and racialized artists. Additionally, the NFB's Documentary Program has a mandate to support diverse voices, and encourages submissions from filmmakers working in a variety of genres and formats. The NFB also runs mentorship and training programs specifically for underrepresented and emerging filmmakers. The focus on diversity and social justice is fundamental to the NFB's approach to filmmaking, as it seeks to represent a wide range of voices and perspectives through its programming.
